data.questionHtml:
Write down the numerator of each of the following rational numbers:
(i) -75
(ii) 15-4
(iii) -17-21
(iv) 89
(v) 5
data.solutionHtml:
Numerators are:
(i) -7
(ii) 15
(iii) -17
(iv) 8
(v) 5

data.questionHtml:
Write down the denominator of each of the following rational numbers:
(i) -45
(ii) 11-34
(iii) -15-82
(iv) 15
(v) 0
data.solutionHtml:
Denominators are:
(i) 5
(ii) -34
(iii) -82
(iv) 1
(v) 1

data.questionHtml: Write down the rational number whose numerator is (−3) × 4, and whose denominator is (34 − 23) × (7 − 4).
data.solutionHtml:
According to the question:

Numerator = (-3) × 4 = -12

Denominator = (34 - 23) × (7 - ​4) = 11 × 3 = 33

∴ Rational number = -1233

data.questionHtml:
Write the following rational numbers as integers:
71, -121, 341, -731, 951
data.solutionHtml: Integers are 7, -12, 34, -73 and 95.

data.questionHtml:
Write the following integers as rational numbers with denominator 1:
-15, 17, 85, -100
data.solutionHtml:
Rational numbers of given integers with denominator 1 are:

-151, 171,851,-1001

data.questionHtml: Write down the rational number whose numerator is the smallest three digit number and denominator is the largest four digit number.
data.solutionHtml:
Smallest three-digit number = 100

Largest four-digit number = 9999

∴ Required rational number = 1009999

data.questionHtml:
Separate positive and negative rational numbers from the following rational numbers:

-5-7, 12-5, 74, 13-9, 0, -18-7, -95116, -1-9
data.solutionHtml:
Given rational numbers can be rewritten as:

57. -125, 74, -139, 0 , 187, -95116, 19

Thus, positive rational numbers are:

57, 74, 187,19
or, -5-7, 74, 0, -18-7. -6-9

Negative rational numbers are:

-125, -139, -95116
or, 12-5, 13-9, -95116

data.questionHtml:
Which of the following rational numbers are positive:
(i) -87
(ii) 98
(iii) -19-13
(iv) -2113
data.solutionHtml:
The numbers can be rewritten as:

 (i)  -87(ii)  98(iii)  1913(iv) -2113

Positive rational numbers are (ii) and (iii), i.e., 98 and -19-13.

data.questionHtml:
Which of the following rational numbers are negative?
(i) -37
(ii) -5-8
(iii) 9-83
(iv) -115-197
data.solutionHtml:
The  numbers can be rewritten as:
(i) -37(ii) 58(iii) -983(iv) 115197

Negative rational numbers are (i) and (iii).

data.questionHtml:
Express each of the following as a rational number with positive denominator:
(i) -15-28
(ii) 6-9
(iii) -28-11
(iv) 19-7
data.solutionHtml:
Rational number with positive denominators:

(i) Multiplying the number by -1, we get:

-15-28=-15×-1-28×-1=1528

(ii) Multiplying the number by -1, we get: 

6-9=6×-1-9×-1=-69

(iii) Multiplying the number by -1, we get:

-28-11=-28×-1-11×-1=2811

(iv) Multiplying the number by -1, we get:

19-7=19×-1-7×-1=-197

data.questionHtml:
Express 35 as a rational number with numerator:
(i) 6
(ii) −15
(iii) 21
(iv) −27
data.solutionHtml:
Rational number with numerator:

(i) 6 is:

3×25×2 = 610 (multiplying numerator and denominator by 2)

(ii)

-15 is:3×-55×-5 = -15-25 (multiplying numerator and denominator by -5)

(iii)

21 is:3×75×7 = 2135 (multiplying numerator and denominator by 7)

(iv)

-27 is:3×-95×-9 = -27-45 (multiplying numerator and denominator by -9)

data.questionHtml:
Express 57 as a rational number with denominator:
(i) −14
(ii) 70
(iii) −28
(iv) −84
data.solutionHtml:
57 as a rational number with denominator:
(i) −14 is:

5×-27×-2  = -10-14 (Multiplying numerator and denominator by -2)
(ii) 70 is:

5×107×10 = 5070 (Multiplying numerator and denominator by 10)

(iii) −28 is:

5×-47×-4 = -20-28 (Multiplying numerator and denominator by -4)

(iv) −84 is:

5×-127×-12 = -60-84 (Multiplying numerator and denominator by -12)

data.questionHtml:
Express 34 as a rational number with denominator:
(i) 20
(ii) 36
(iii) 44
(iv) −80
data.solutionHtml:
3/4 as rational number with denominator:

(i)
20 is:3×54×5=1520 (multiplying numerator and denominator by 5)


(ii)
36 is:3×94×9 = 2736 (multiplying numerator and denominator by 9)


(iii)
44 is:3×114×11 = 3344 (multiplying numerator and denominator by 11)

(iv)
-80 is:3×-204×-20 = -60-80 (multiplying numerator and denominator by -20)

data.questionHtml:
Express 25 as a rational number with numerator:
(i) −56
(ii) 154
(iii) −750
(iv) 500
data.solutionHtml:
2/5 as a rational number with numerator:

(i)
-56 is:2×285×-28 =-56-140 (multiplying numerator and denominator by -28)

(ii)
154 is:2×775×77 = 154385 (multiplying numerator and denominator by 77)

(iii)
-750 is:2×-3755×-375 = -750-1875 (multiplying numerator and denominator by -375)

(iv)
500 is:2×2505×250 = 5001250 (multiplying numerator and denominator by 250)

data.questionHtml:
Express -192108 as a rational number with numerator:
(i) 64
(ii) −16
(iii) 32
(iv) −48
data.solutionHtml:
Rational number with numerator:

(i) 64 as numerator: -192/-3108/-3 =64-36 (Dividing the numerator and denomintor by -3)(ii) -16 as numerator: -192/12108/12 = -169 (Dividing the numerator and denomintor by 12)(iii) 32 as numerator: -192/-6108/-6 =  32-18 (Dividing the numerator and denomintor by -6)(iv) -48 as numerator: -192/4108/4 = -4827 (Dividing the numerator and denomintor by 4)

data.questionHtml:
Express 168-294 as a rational number with denominator:
(i) 14
(ii) −7
(iii) −49
(iv) 1470
data.solutionHtml:
Rational number with denominator:

(i) 14 as denominator: 168/-21-294/-21 = -814   (Dividing the numerator and denomintor by -21)(ii) -7  as denominator: 168/42-294/42 = 4-7   (Dividing the numerator and denomintor by 42)(iii) -49 as denominator: 168/6-294/6 = 28-49   (Dividing the numerator and denomintor by 6)(iv) 1470  as denominator: 168×-5-294×-5 = -8401470   (Multiplying the numerator and denomintor by -5)

data.questionHtml:
Write -1442 in a form so that the numerator is equal to:
(i) −2
(ii) 7
(iii) 42
(iv) −70
data.solutionHtml:
Rational number with numerator:

(i) -2 is: -14/742/7= -26 ( Dividing numerator and denominator by 7)
(ii) 7 is: -14/-242/-2 = 7-21 ( Dividing numerator and denominator by -2)
(iii) 42 is: -14×-342×-3 =  42-126 ( Multiplying numerator and denominator by -3)
(iv) -70 is: -14×542×5 = -70210 ( Multiplying numerator and denominator by 5)

data.questionHtml:
Select those rational numbers which can be written as a rational number with numerator 6:
122, 23, 34, 4-5, 56, -67, -78
data.solutionHtml:
Given rational numbers that can be written as a rational number with numerator 6 are:

122 (On multiplying by 6) = 613223 (On multiplying by 3) = 6934 (On multiplying by 2) = 68-67 (On multiplying by -1) = 6-7

data.questionHtml:
Select those rational numbers which can be written as a rational number with denominator 4:

78, 6416, 36-12, -1617, 5-4, 14028
data.solutionHtml:
Given rational numbers that can be written as a rational number with denominator 4 are:

78 (On dividing by 2) = 3.546416 (On dividing by 4) =16436-12(On dividing by 3) =12-4 = -124-1617 can't be expressed with a denominator 4.5-4(On multiplying by -1) =-5414028(On dividing by 7) =204
122 (On multiplying by 6) = 613223 (On multiplying by 3) = 6934 (On multiplying by 2) = 68−67 (On multiplying by −1) = 6−7

data.questionHtml:
In each of the following, find an equivalent form of the rational number having a common denominator:
(i) 34 and 512
(ii) 23, 76 and 1112
(iii) 57, 38, 914 and 2021
data.solutionHtml:
Equivalent forms of the rational number having common denominator are:

(i)  34=3×34×3=912 and 512.

(ii)
23=2×43×4=812 and 76=7×26×2=1412 and 1112Forms are 812, 1412 and 1112


(iii)
57=5×247×24=120168 , 38=3×218×21=63168 , 914=9×1214×12=108168 and 2021=20×821×8=160168  Forms are 120168, 63168,108168 and 160168

data.questionHtml:
Determine whether the following rational numbers are in the lowest form or not:

(i) 6584
(ii) -1532
(iii) 24128
(iv) -56-32
data.solutionHtml:
(i) We observe that 65 and 84 have no common factor i..e., their HCF is 1.

Thus, 6584 is in its lowest form.

(ii) We observe that -15 and 32 have no common factor i..e., their HCF is 1.

Thus, -1532is  in  its lowest form.

(iii) HCF of 24 and 128 is not 1.

Thus, given rational number is not in its simplest form.

(iv) HCF of 56 and 32 is 8.

Thus, given rational number is not in its simplest form.

data.questionHtml:
Express each of the following rational numbers to the lowest form:
(i) 422
(ii) -36180
(iii) 132-428
(iv) -32-56
data.solutionHtml:
Lowest form of:
(i) 422 is:4 =2×222 = 2×11HCF of 4 and 22 is 2.Dividing the fraction by 2 , we get  211.(ii)  -36180 is:36 = 3×3×2×2180 = 5×3×3×2×2HCF of  36 and 180 is 36.Dividing the fraction by 36 , we get -15
(iii) 132-428 is:132 = 2×3×2×11 428 = 2×2×107HCF of 132 and 428 is 4.Dividing the fraction by 4 , we get   33-107(iv) -32-56 is:32 =2×2×2×2×256 = 2×2×2×7HCF of 32 and 56 is 8. Dividing the fraction by 8, we get47

data.questionHtml:
Write each of the following rational numbers in the standard form:
(i) 210
(ii) -836
(iii) 4-16
(iv) -15-35
(v) 299-161
(vi) -63-210
(vii) 68-119
(viii) -195275
data.solutionHtml:
(i) The denominator is positive and HCF of 2 and 10 is 2.

∴ Dividing the numerator and denominator by 2, we get:

210= 2/210/2 = 15

(ii) The denominator is positive and HCF of 8 and 36 is 4.

∴ Dividing the numerator and denominator by 4, we get:

-836 =-8/436/4 = -29

(iii)

The denominator is negative.

4×-1-16×-1 = -416

HCF of 4 and 16 is 4.

∴ Dividing the numerator and denominator by 4, we get:

-4/416/4 = -14

(iv) The denominator is negative.

-15×-1-35×-1 = 1535

HCF of 15 and 35 is 5.

∴ Dividing the numerator and denominator by 5, we get:

15/535/5  = 37

(v) The denominator is negative.

299×-1-161×-1 = -299161

HCF of 299 and 161 is 23.

∴ Dividing the numerator and denominator by 23, we get:

 -299/23161/23 =-137

(vi) The denominator is negative.

-63×-1-210×-1 = 63210

HCF of 63 and 210 is 21.

∴ Dividing the numerator and denominator by 21, we get:

63/21210/21 = 310

(vii) The denominator is negative.

68×-1-119×-1 = -68119

HCF of 68 and 119 is 17.

∴ Dividing the numerator and denominator by 17, we get:

 -68/17119/17 = -47

(viii) The denominator is positive and HCF of 195 and 275 is 5.

∴ Dividing divide the numerator and denominator by 5, we get:
 
 -195/5275/5 = -3955

data.questionHtml:
Which of the following rational numbers are equal?
(i) -912 and 8-12
(ii) -1620 and 20-25
(iii) -721 and 3-9
(iv) -814 and 1321
data.solutionHtml:
(i)
The standard form of -912is  -9/312/3 = -34The standard form of 8-12 is 8/-4-12/-4 = -23Since, the standard forms of two rational numbers are not same.Hence, they are not equal.

(ii)
Since, LCM of 20 and 25 is 100.Therefore making the denominators equal, -1620=-16×520×5=-80100 and 20-25=-20×425×4=-80100.Therefore, -1620=20-25.


(iii)
Since, LCM of 21 and 9 is  63.Therefore making the denominators equal, -721=-7×321×3=-2163 and 3-9=-3×79×7=-2163.Therefore, -721=3-9.


(iv)
Since, LCM of 14 and 21 is 42.Therefore making the denominators equal, -814=-8×314×3=-2442 and 1321=13×221×2=2642.Therefore, -814is not equal to 1321.

data.questionHtml:
If each of the following pairs represents a pair of equivalent rational numbers, find the values of x:
(i) 23 and 5x
(ii) -37 and x4
(iii) 35 and x-25
(iv) 136 and -65x
data.solutionHtml:
(i) 23=5x, then x=5×32= 152
(ii) -37=x4, then x=-37×4= -127
(iii) 35=x-25, then x=35×(-25)=-755 =-15
(iv) 136=-65x, then x=613×(-65)=6×(-5)= -30

data.questionHtml:
In each of the following, fill in the blanks so as to make the statement true:
(i) A number which can be expressed in the form pq, where p and q are integers and q is not equal to zero, is called a .....

(ii) If the integers p and q have no common divisor other than 1 and q is positive, then the rational number pq is said to be in the ....
(iii) Two rational numbers are said to be equal, if they have the same .... form.
ab=a÷m....
(v) If p and q are positive integers, then pq is a ..... rational number and p-q is a ..... rational number.

(vi) The standard form of −1 is ...

(vii) If pq is a rational number, then q cannot be ....
(viii) Two rational numbers with different numerators are equal, if their numerators are in the same .... as their denominators.
data.solutionHtml:
(i) rational number
(ii) standard rational number
(iii) standard form
(iv) ab=a÷mb÷m
(v) positive rational number, negative rational number
(vi) -11
(vii) zero
(viii) ratio

data.questionHtml:
In each of the following state if the statement is true (T) or false (F):
(i) The quotient of two integers is always an integer.
(ii) Every integer is a rational number.
(iii) Every rational number is an integer.
(iv) Every fraction is a rational number.
(v) Every rational number is a fraction
(vi) If ab is a rational number and m any integer, then ab=a×mb×m
(vii) Two rational numbers with different numerators cannot be equal.
(viii) 8 can be written as a rational number with any integer as denominator.
(ix) 8 can be written as a rational number with any integer as numerator.
(x) 23 is equal to 46.
data.solutionHtml:
(i) False; not necessary
(ii) True; every integer can be expressed in the form of p/q, where q is not zero.
(iii) False; not necessary
(iv) True; every fraction can be expressed in the form of p/q, where q is not zero.
(v) False; not necessary
(vi) True
(vii) False; they can be equal, when simplified further.
(viii) False
(ix) False
(x) True; in the standard form, they are equal.

data.questionHtml:
Which of the two rational numbers in each of the following pairs of rational numbers is greater?
(i) -38, 0
(ii) 52, 0
(iii) -411, 311
(iv) -712, 5-8
(v) 4-9, -3-7
(vi) -58, 3-4
(vii) 59, -3-8
(viii) 5-8, -712
data.solutionHtml:
(i) We know that every positive rational number is greater than zero and every negative rational number is smaller than zero. Thus,

-38>0
(ii) 52>0. Because every positive rational number is greater than zero and every negative rational number is smaller than zero. 
(iii) -48<311. Because every positive rational number is greater than zero and every negative rational number is smaller than zero. 
(iv)

-712=-7×212×2=-1424 and 5-8=-5×38×3=-1524Therefore, -712>5-8

(v)

4-9=-4×79×7=-2863 and -3-7=3×77×9=2163Therefore, 4-9<-3-7
(vi)

-58 and 3-4=-3×24×2=-68Therefore, -58>3-4

(vii)

59=5×89×8=4072 and -3-8=3×98×9=2772Therefore,59>-3-8

(viii)
-712=-7×212×2=-1424 and 5-8=-5×38×3=-1524Therefore, -712>5-8

data.questionHtml:
Which of the two rational numbers in each of the following pairs of rational numbers is smaller?
(i) -6-13, 713
(ii) 16-5, 3
(iii) -43, 8-7
(iv) -125, -3
data.solutionHtml:
(i) -6-13=613<713
(ii) 16-5<3
(iii)
-43=-4×73×7=-2821 and 8-7=-8×37×3=-2421Therefore, -43<8-7
(iv)
-125 and -3 = -3×51×5=-155Therefore -125>-3

Fill in the blanks by the correct symbol out of >, =, or <:
(i) -67.....713
(ii) -35.....-56
(iii) -23.....5-8
(iv) 0 .....-25

data.questionHtml:
Arrange the following rational numbers in ascending order:
(i) 35, -17-30, 8-15, -710
(ii) -49, 5-12, 7-18, 2-3
data.solutionHtml:
(i) Ascending order:

Since, LCM of 5, -30, -15, 10 is 30.Multiplying the numerators and denominators to get the denominator equal to the LCM, 35=3×65×6=1830, 1730= 17×130×1 = 1730, 8-15=-8×215×2=-1630, -710=-7×310×3=-2130.Order is -21 <-16<17<8.Order is -710<8-15<1730<35.

(ii)

Since, LCM of 9, -12, -18, 3 is 36.Multiplying the numerators and denominators to get the denominator equal to the LCM, -49=-4×49×4=-1636 5-12=-5×312×3=-1536 7-18=-7×218×2=-1436 2-3=-2×123×12=-2436.Order is -24 <-16<-15<-14.Order is 2-3<-49<5-12<7-18.

data.questionHtml:
Arrange the following rational numbers in descending order:
(i) 78, 6416, 36-12, 5-4, 14028
(ii) -310, 17-30, 7-15, -1120
data.solutionHtml:
We have to arrange them in descending order.

(i)
Since, LCM of 8, 16, -12, -4, 28 is 336.Multiplying the numerators and denominators, to get the denominator equal to the LCM, 78=7×428×42=294336, 6416=64×2116×21=1344336,  36-12=-36×2812×28=-1008336,  5-4=-5×844×84=-420336, 14028=140×1228×12=1680336.Order is 1680> 1344 >294 >-420>-1008.Order is 14028>6416>78>5-4>36-12.
(ii)

Since, LCM of 10, -30, -15, 20 is 60.Multiplying the numerators and denominators, to get the denominator equal to the LCM, -310=-3×610×6=-1860, 17-30=-17×230×2=-3460,  7-15=-7×415×4=-2860,  -1120=-11×320×3=-3360, Order is, -18>-28>-33>-34.Order is -310>7-15>-1120>17-30.

data.questionHtml:
Which of the following statements are true:
(i) The rational number 2923 lies to the left of zero on the number line.
(ii) The rational number -12-17 lies to the left of zero on the number line.
(iii) The rational number 34 lies to the right of zero on the number line.
(iv) The rational numbers -12-5 and -717 are on the opposite side of zero on the number line.
(v) The rational numbers -21-5 and 7-31 are on the opposite side of zero on the number line.
(vi) The rational number -3-5 is one the right of -47 on the number line.
data.solutionHtml:
(i) False; it lies to the right of zero because it is a positive number.
(ii) False; it lies to the right of zero because it is a positive number.
(iii) True
(iv) True; they are of opposite signs.
(v) False; they both are of same signs.
(v) True; they both are of opposite signs and positive number is greater than the negative number. Thus, it is on the right of the negative number.

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

44-77 in standard form is

(a) 4-7                                 (b) -47                                 (c) -4477                                 (d) None of these
data.solutionHtml:
The denominator of 44-77 is negative.

Firstly, multiply the numerator and denominator by −1 to make it positive.

44-77=44×-1-77×-1=-4477

Now,

HCF of 44 and 77 = 11

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -4477 by 11, we have

-4477=-44÷1177÷11=-47=-47

Thus, the standard form of 44-77 is -47.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

-102119 in standard form is

(a) -67                                 (b) 67                                 (c) -617                                 (d) None of these
data.solutionHtml:
The denominator of the rational number -102119 is positive.

In order to write the rational number in standard form, divide its numerator and denominator by the HCF of 102 and 119.

HCF of 102 and 119 = 17

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -102119 by 17, we have

-102119=-102÷17119÷17=-67

Thus, the standard form of -102119 is -67.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

A rational number equal to -23 is

(a) -1025                                 (b) 10-15                                 (c) -96                                 (d) None of these
data.solutionHtml:
We know that two rational numbers are equal if they have the same standard form.

The rational number -23 is in its standard form.

Consider the rational number 10-15.

This rational number can be expressed in standard form as follows:

10-15=10×-1-15×-1=-1015                  (Multiplying numerator and denominator by −1 to make denominator positive)

HCF of 10 and 15 = 5

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -1015 by 5, we have

-1015=-10÷515÷5=-23

Thus, the standard form of -1015 is -23, which is same as the given rational number.

So, the rational number equal to -23 is 10-15.

Let us check why options (a) and (c) are not correct.

The standard form of -1025 is -25.

HCF of 10 and 25 = 5

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -1025 by 5, we have

-1025=-10÷525÷5=-25            

The standard form of -96 is -32.

HCF of 6 and 9 = 3

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -96 by 3, we have

-96=-9÷36÷2=-32            

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If -37=x35, then x =

(a) 15                                 (b) 21                                 (c) −15                                  (d) −21
data.solutionHtml:
Firstly, write -37 as a rational number with denominator 35.

Multiplying the numerator and denominator of -37 by 5, we have

-37=-3×57×5=-1535

∴-37=x35⇒-1535=x35⇒x=-15

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following is correct?

(a) 59>-3-8                                 (b) 59<-3-8                                 (c) 2-3<-87                                 (d) 4-3>-87
data.solutionHtml:
Consider the rational numbers 59 and -3-8.

We write the rational number -3-8 with positive denominator.
-3-8=-3×-1-8×-1=38

Now, we write the rational numbers so that they have a common denominator.

LCM of 8 and 9 = 72

So, 59=5×89×8=4072 and 38=3×98×9=2772

Now,

40>27⇒4072>2772⇒59>38⇒59>-3-8

It can also be checked that 2-3>-87 and 4-3<-87.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If the rational numbers -23 and 4x represent a pair of equivalent rational numbers, then x =

(a) 6                                 (b) −6                                 (c) 3                                 (d) −3
data.solutionHtml:
It is given that the rational numbers -23 and 4x represent a pair of equivalent rational numbers.

We know that the values of two equivalent rational numbers is equal. 

∴-23=4x⇒-2×x=4×3                     ab=cd⇒ad=bc⇒-2x=12⇒-2x-2=12-2                       Dividing both sides by -2⇒x=-6

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

What is the additive identity element in the set of whole numbers?

(a) 0                                 (b) 1                                 (c) −1                                 (d) None of these
data.solutionHtml:
If a is a whole number then a + 0 = a = 0 + a.

Therefore, 0 is the additive identity element for addition of whole number because it does not change the identity or value of the whole number during the operation of addition.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

What is the multiplicative identity element in the set of whole numbers?

(a) 0                                 (b) 1                                 (c) −1                                 (d) None of these
data.solutionHtml:
We know that if a is a whole number, then a × 1 = a = 1 × a.

Therefore, 1 is the multiplicative identity element for multiplication of whole numbers because it does not change the identity or value of the whole number during the operation of multiplication.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following is not zero?

(a) 0 × 0                                 (b) 03                                 (c) 7-73                                 (d) 9 ÷ 0
data.solutionHtml:
If any number is multiplied by 0, the product is 0.

∴ 0 × 0 = 0

If 0 is divided by any number (≠ 0), the quotient is always 0.

∴ 03=0 and 7-73=03=0

Division of any number by 0 is meaningless and is not defined.

∴ 9 ÷ 0 is not defined.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The whole number nearest to 457 and divisible by 11 is

(a) 450                                 (b) 451                                 (c) 460                                 (d) 462
data.solutionHtml:
The numbers 450 and 460 are not divisible by 11.

Now, both the numbers 451 and 462 are divisible by 11.

Distance between 457 and 451 on the number line = 457 − 451 = 6

Distance between 457 and 462 on the number line = 462 − 457 = 5

Thus, the whole number nearest to 457 and divisible by 11 is 462.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If -38 and x-24 are equivalent rational numbers, then x =

(a) 3                                 (b) 6                                 (c) 9                                 (d) 12
data.solutionHtml:
It is given that the rational numbers -38 and x-24 are equivalent rational numbers.

We know that the values of two equivalent rational numbers is equal. 

∴x-24=-38⇒x×8=-3×-24                     ab=cd⇒ad=bc⇒8x=72⇒8x8=728                                   Dividing both sides by 8⇒x=9

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If 27-45 is expressed as a rational number with denominator 5, then the numerator is

(a) 3                                 (b) −3                                 (c) 6                                 (d) −6
data.solutionHtml:
In order to express 27-45 as a rational number with denominator 5, firstly find a number which gives 5 when −45 is divided by it.

This number is −45 ÷ 5 = −9.

Dividing the numerator and denominator of 27-45 by −9, we have

27-45=27÷-9-45÷-9=-35

Thus, the numerator is −3.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following pairs of rational numbers are on the opposite side of the zero on the number line?

(a) 37 and 512                                 (b) -37 and -512                                 (c) 37 and -512                                 (d) None of these
data.solutionHtml:
The rational numbers 37 and 512 are positive rational numbers. We know that every positive rational number is greater than 0, so both the rational numbers 37 and 512 are represented by points on the right of the zero on the number line.

The rational numbers -37 and -512 are negative rational numbers. We know that every negative rational number is less than 0, so both the rational numbers 37 and 512 are represented by points on the left of the zero on the number line.

The rational numbers 37 is a positive rational number whereas the rational number -512 is a negative rational numbers. We know that every negative rational number is less than 0 and every positive rational number is greater than 0, so the rational number 37 is represented by point on the right of the zero and -512 is represented by point on the left of the zero on the number line.
Thus, the rational numbers 37 and -512 are on the opposite side of the zero on the number line.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The rational number equal to 2-3 is

(a) 14-18                                 (b) -69                                 (c) -8-12                                 (d) 3-2
data.solutionHtml:
We know that two rational numbers are equal if they have the same standard form.

2-3=2×-1-3×-1=-23

The standard form of 2-3 is -23.

Consider the rational number -69.

HCF of 6 and 9 = 3

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -69 by 3, we have

-69=-6÷39÷3=-23

Thus, the standard form of -69 is -23.

So, the rational number -69 is equal to 2-3.

It can be checked that

Standard form of 14-18 = -79

Standard form of -8-12 = 23

Standard form of 3-2 = -32

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If -34=6x, then x =

(a) −8                                 (b) 4                                 (c) −4                                 (d) 8
data.solutionHtml:
-34=6x⇒-3×x=6×4                     ab=cd⇒ad=bc⇒-3x=24⇒-3x-3=24-3                       Dividing both sides by -3⇒x=-8

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).
